thread.title: CBB Kim Woodburn reveals harrowing sexual abuse at the hands of her own father in shocking Loose Women interview
thread.title_full: CBB Kim Woodburn reveals harrowing sexual abuse at the hands of her own father in shocking Loose Women interview

author: Hayley Minn
title: CBB Kim Woodburn reveals harrowing sexual abuse at the hands of her own father in shocking Loose Women interview
text:
CBB Kim Woodburn reveals harrowing sexual abuse at the hands of her own father in shocking Loose Women interview The Celebrity Big Brother star opened up on Loose Women Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Kim Woodburn she was sexually abused as a child Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Kim Woodburn has revealed her father sexually abused her when she was a child. 
Speaking on Loose Women, the Celebrity Big Brother star opened up about her horrific childhood. 
Starting off with her mum, she revealed: "Her favourite phrase was, 'If I’d have known what you were going to be like, I’d have sent you back.' 
"I don’t let it affect my life, but I’ll see a parent and child out, and think, 'You're a good mum.'" Read More Kim Woodburn revealed she was sexually abused by her dad (Photo: ITV) Kim opened up on the horrific ordeal (Photo: ITV) 
Kim then revealed her dad "touched my naughty bits when he thought he'd get away with it". 
She added: "He physically abused me, and my mum beat me up with carpet brushes. 
"I was very young." 
As she was pressed for more information from Janet Street Porter, Kim then confirmed: "It was sexual abuse. 
"I didn't tell my mum, I didn't know how. Read More Kim never told her mum (Photo: ITV) 
"And, remember, you didn't discuss sexual things in those days." 
Kim then said it turned her into "a very kind person". 
She said: "Believe it or not, I'm a soft, silly old fool of a woman. 
"But don’t start of me for no reason, or I’ll crucify you." 
*Loose Women continues on ITV1 weekdays at 12.30pm Like us on Facebook
